text: Are there any sexagesimal parsing/formatting packages available?  I have a few such functions that I've written more times than I care to admit.  I tend to stuff them in various packages that I'm working on, but they seem more generally useful that it seems like there might be support for this already.

text:
FWIW, my functions usually end up with names like `dms2d` for sexagesimal "dd:mm:ss..." to decimal degrees, `dms2h` for sexagesimal "dd:mm:ss..." to decimal hours, and `dms2r` for sexagesimal "dd:mm:ss..." to decimal radians.  I usually also make `hms2h` an alias of `dms2d` and add `hms2d` for sexagesimal "hh:mm:ss..." to decimal degrees (and likewise `hms2r` for radians).  I also like to have a `@dms_str` macro (with an alias `@hms_str`) that just passes the string argument to `dms2d`so I can do things like:
```julia> deg = dms"12:34:56.789"
12.582441388888888```

text: <@U01FKQQ7J0J> I very much intend for a suite of string parsing and formatting methods to be included in SkyCoords.jl, although that’s a couple items down my list. If you’d be willing to put it in a PR it’d be progress towards that goal!

text: I think the end goal will be to have a struct for generating formatter strings, which lets us write the parsing/printing logic once as well as letting users customize.
